James Cook University (JCU) offers a variety of Graduate Inquiry School awards scholarships to students of unique research prospective tasks, a Higher Degree by Research

(Doctorate or Masters by Research) at James Cook University. The scholarships are provided to assist with the general living costs of the candidate.

Eligibility criteria for the JCU Postgraduate Research Scholarship:

  • Candidates from all nationalities are qualified.
  • All applicants must validate a brilliant academic top.
  • Candidates must register in slightly of the postgraduate courses of scholarship.
  • Candidates must encounter the English Language obligation.

Benefits of the JCU Postgraduate Research Scholarship:

Grants include exceptions from Schooling Fees for the period of the scholarship and a existing grant of value $28,092 per annum.

James Cook University scholarships Requirement

The requirements for James Cook University (JCU) scholarships may vary depending on the specific scholarship program. However, here are some general requirements that applicants may need to meet:

Academic excellence:

Most JCU scholarships require applicants to have a high academic achievement. This could be demonstrated through academic transcripts, GPA, and other academic records.

Course and level of study:

Scholarships may be available for specific courses or levels of study, such as undergraduate or postgraduate studies.

Citizenship:

Some scholarships may only be available to Australian citizens, while others may be open to international students.

English language proficiency:

International students may be required to demonstrate their English language proficiency through IELTS or other English language tests.

Leadership and community involvement:

Some scholarships may give preference to applicants who have demonstrated leadership skills or community involvement.

Research potential:

For research scholarships, applicants may need to have a strong research background and demonstrate potential for future research.
